over.title: This line is indented incorrectly
over.message: This line is overindented. You should indent your program one tab further every time you open a curly brace and indent one tab less every time you close a curly brace. This line should be indented more.

under.title: This line is indented incorrectly
under.message: This line is underindented. You should indent your program one tab further every time you open a curly brace and indent one tab less every time you close a curly brace. This line should be indented more.

long_lines.title: This line is too long (over 100 characters)
long_lines.message: Lines of code should ideally max out at 80 characters, and should never exceed 100 characters in length. Lines that are too long should be broken up and wrapped to the next line.

naming_conventions.title: This name has the wrong naming conventions.

message.screaming: Constant names should be SCREAMING_CASED, in all uppercase letters with words separated by underscores.

backslash_n.title: \n should only be used in printf.
backslash_n.message: \n should only be used in printf statements, and only once at the end of the line. Otherwise, you should just use println if you want to print a full line.

blank.title: A blank println should actually be blank
blank.messgae: You should always print a blank line using System.out.println(). Printing an empty String (System.out.println("")) is considered bad style; it makes the intention less clear.

empty_struct.title: There's no need for this structure

equals_true.title: You should never test booleans for equality
equals_true.message: rather than testing if a boolean x is equal to true, you should just use x itself as a condition

equals_false.title: You should never test booleans for equality
equals_false.message: rather than testing if a boolean x is equal to false, you should just use !x itself as a condition

scanners.title: There should be one Scanner per source

one_per_line: You should limit your code to one statement per line.
